column4: is it my imagination or is lucid lynx just less stable than karmic was?
well it has errors and doesn't want to install on some machines karmic worked fine on
I never had probs with ata2 errors before and I couldn't install it on my sisters desktop at all when karmi worked a charm
well it *is* new and all I guess
lucid works pretty good in most respects on my eeepc tho
the UNE
i
ic
weird thing was the only eeebuntu that worked on this eeepc900 well was standard 2.0
most stuff that was in eebuntu is in newer linux likr ubuntu lucid
well I had everything working including applet which controlled fan, cpu, on/off for reader, bluetooth, etc.. but don't have that working on lucid
but at least the hotkeys work for acpi stuff
look up eee im sysanptic you will find eeeacpi scripts to enable all of that
I've already tried all that.. none of it works right.. some of it partially
I think the eeepc 900 is just quirky or something
900a hear
yeah I read some people had good luck with other models
well all eebuntu used was the array.org kernel maybe that will work for you
if they have a lucid build
